L.H.O.O.Q. is a work of art by Marcel Duchamp. First conceived in 1919, the work 
is one of what Duchamp referred to as readymades, or more specifically an 
assisted ready-made. The readymade involves taking mundane, often utilitarian 
objects not generally considered to be art and transforming them, by adding to 
them, .... The Mona Lisa painting is unmodified but for the inscription LHOOQ 
rase.
